item.description: New background image. This will be the one I use for a while, changing every month was too ambitous. Will iterate on it as I learn the art tools! Also, fixed the header on mobile views.
Minified the images to improve performance. Update the github action.
New article up! I also added some CSS for deck lists since Card Games will come up a lot. Also added Github link and CC license.

item.title: Eggs in a Basket
item.description: Made it through the Mystic Island consecutive win Gauntlet! Sharing the deck I used and my strategy, hopefully some will find it helpful!
The January background is up! Also wrapped up some thoughts on Pokemon Pocket.

item.title: Tempo and Card Advantage in Pokemon Pocket
item.description: Pokemon Pocket has taken up a lot of time recently. It really scratches that TCG itch! Here I go over some of the things I have learned playing card games, and how they apply to Pokemon Pocket.
A little late, but the december tile is ready!

item.title: Improving_workflow
item.description: Getting up and running is only part of the problem. I found my workflow very cumbersome which made writing feel more like a chore than something fun. Here I talk about the changes I made to make updating the website painless.
Got some github actions set up to automatically deploy the website. Should hopefully make it easier to keep this updated!

item.title: About
item.description:
About

Hey there! I’m deviaan and this is my hobby site. Primarily, its a place to share anything interesting I might stumble onto, and share projects or stories–if I ever finish any of them. I hope you get as much of a kick out of being here as I did making it!

Gear

I’ve always been intrigued by the tools and techs people use, so I thought I’d share mine for anyone who shares that curiosity!
Got the new tile made, though it is a bit late.
The basic skeleton of the site is done! Lots of cleaning up and optimizing to do, though!

item.title: Up and Running
item.description: My first post! I’m not sure if it’s a tradition, but in this one I just talk about why I wanted to make this and how I made it. Not really a tutorial, but more just picking reasons to do X over Y, along with links to resources that helped me get started!
We are live! The site is mostly placeholder text right now, but during the week should see frequent updates!
